communication.message: I currently have 88 units in inventory and 0 units in backlog. I made a profit of 60.0 last round. Based on recent demand, I observed a mean demand of 12 units. My general ordering approach is to maintain sufficient inventory to meet demand while avoiding excessive holding costs. Therefore, I plan to order 12 units this round to align with the observed demand and maintain a buffer. I propose that we coordinate our orders to ensure we collectively maintain enough inventory to meet at least 3 rounds of expected demand across the supply chain. This will help us avoid stockouts and stabilize our operations.
communication.strategy_hint: Focus on maintaining a buffer to meet demand while avoiding excess inventory.
communication.collaboration_proposal: Let's aim to keep our inventory levels sufficient to cover at least 3 rounds of expected demand across the chain.
